titleStmt.title: Dorsey Plummer et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8566

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Foster Kentucky Nov 21st 62
To the Honorable Govenour of State of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Bracken and Pendleton Countyes do prey your honor and Excellency to remit a fine of thirty dollars that was assest aganst Washington Shaver on the account of Said Shaver being present when a few soldiers was Insulted by a Secesh, the Soldiers rocked him and his old tobacco house, the Secesh warranted the Soldiers and Could not do any thing with them He then pitched his Spite on Shaver and warranted him and proved by two Secesh that Shaver told the Soldiers to continue to rock the Secesh, Shaver Swears he did not, the Jury was ten in number they was all Secesh and Sothern Sympathisers Except three the Secesh in our neighborhood Envies Shaver on the account of his Union principals Shaver is a through-going Union man the Secesh can not make a moove but without Shaver finding it out he has been one of our best men in holding the rebels in check in our neighborhood and they hate him as they hate old Saton Shaver is a poore man and has a large family and a wife with only one arm we the undersigned do Solamlly believe that, it was through Secesh Malice that the fine ^was^ assest we present our names before your honor that you may have Just reasons to release the fine you will please address Washington Shaver) Foster Bracken Canty) Ky (in haste as he is a waiting your Speedy answer

Dorsey plumer
Simpson Mackbee
James H Moore
Nelson Plummer
W. T. Records
C. W. Saxton
B. F. McGill
John Cowen
N. W. Leming
David Smih
Jacob Caseman
John Cummins
Haines Dickason
S, W, Marshall
J, C, McCane
P Highbanks
John Biddle

Thos. Biddle
John Mathewese

T. T. Downdrd

Eldridg Bush

S. C. Gishom
David, Parker
Fowler Conelly
W. Neal
N, Miller
J. P. Armcost
Jacob ^his X mark^ White

Pettn of W. Shaver
to remit fine
See Bracket & Pendleton representatives
